title: Build Desktop Apps with Electron.js in Just 15 Minutes
author: Dawar bhai
content:
Electron.js is a powerful open-source framework for building **cross-platform desktop apps** using **JavaScript, HTML, and CSS**. Think of it like creating a web app that runs like a native desktop app — on **Windows, macOS, and Linux**. --- ## 1. What is Electron? Electron bundles **Chromium** (browser) and **Node.js** (backend) so you can build GUI apps using web tech. ### Used by: - ✅ VS Code - ✅ Slack - ✅ Discord - ✅ Figma --- ## 2. Install Electron First, install Node.js, then run: ```bash npm init -y npm install electron --save-dev ``` --- ## 3. Create Basic Folder Structure ``` my-electron-app/ ├── main.js ← Electron main process ├── index.html ← UI of the app ├── preload.js ← Secure bridge between Node & UI (optional) └── package.json ``` --- ## 4. Basic Electron App ### 📄 `main.js` ```js const { app, BrowserWindow } = require('electron'); function createWindow() { const win = new BrowserWindow({ width: 800, height: 600, }); win.loadFile('index.html'); } app.whenReady().then(createWindow); ``` ### 📄 `index.html` ```html My Electron App
